intro: Notopterygium forbesii var. oviforme, commonly known as the ovate leafed notopterygium, is a variant of the notopterygium plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats at high altitudes. Its leaves are ovate in shape, with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces small, clustered fruits. This variant is valued in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
